europeana:record.dc:title: Boreus hyemalis 's nachts in copula op een boomstam gevonden (Mecoptera: Boreidae)
Nederlandse Faunistische Mededelingen
europeana:record.dc:creator: Spijkers H

europeana:record.dc:subject: Insecta
Mecoptera
Boreidae
Nederland
Verspreiding
Biotopen
Gedrag
europeana:record.dc:description: A copula of Boreus hyemalis found on the stem of a tree at night (Mecoptera: Boreidae) During a winter night a copula of Boreus hyemalis (Linnaeus, 1767) was found on the stem of a tree (30 cm above the ground) in a dense forest near Goirle (province of Noord- Brabant). This is a remarkable observation because Boreus is thought to be a ground dwelling species, associated with open sand dunes and active during the daytime. Observations of insects on tree stems during winter nights prove to be very rewarding.
